intro: Saussurea rectinervis, commonly known as the straight-veined saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and pale yellow to white ray flowers. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
